document.masterDocTitle: Coralliophilinae (Neogastropoda: Muricidae) from the southwest Pacific

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Coralliophilinae (Neogastropoda: Muricidae) from the southwest Pacific
Mémoires du Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Latiaxis pagodus
- Abbott & Dance 1990: 156. —
Springsteen & Leobrera 1986: 160
(as A. Adams “1852”; non A.
Adams 1853: 269
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPE MATERIAL. —
Latiaxis spinosus
: possibly lost. —
Coralliophila spinosa
: holotype USNM 111045 , figured by
Higo et al. (2001: 68
G2448)
. —
Latiaxis multispinosus
: holotype KPM 3757 , figured by Kosuge & Suzuki (1985: pl. 30, fig. 8) [examined good photographs only]
. —
Latiaxis jeanneae
: holotype and paratype SDSNH 79499 , figured by Kosuge & Suzuki (1985: pl. 30, figs 1, 2)
.

TYPE LOCALITY. —
L. spinosus : Kashiwajima Tosa, SW Shikoku
, Japan . —
C. spinosa
: off Honshū , 63 fms [
115 m
] sand (
Albatross
stn 3700)
. —
L. multispinosus
: off Nada , Kii Peninsula , Gobō District , Japan
. —
L. jeanneae
: Bohol Straits , Philippines
.

MATERIAL EXAMINED. — Coral Sea . MUSORSTOM 5: stn 255, 168°08’E , 235-252 m , 1 dd; stn DW 156, 24°46’S , 168°08’E , Banc Capel, 25°15’S , 159°55’E , 280-295 m , 2 dd; stn 280, Banc 275-300 m , 1 dd; stn DW 158, 24°47’S , 168°08’E , 262-290 m , 3 Kelso, 24°10’S , 159°36’E , 270 m , 1 dd; stn 294, Banc Argo, dd. —
NORFOLK 1: stn CP 1676, Banc Kaimon-Maru, 24°43’S , 23°11’S , 159°30’E ,
272 m
, 1 dd; stn 304, Banc Nova, 22°10’S , 168°09’E ,
227-232 m
, 2 dd; stn CP 1681, Banc Kaimon-Maru, 159°26’E ,
385-420 m
, 1 dd. 24°44’S , 168°10’E ,
228-240 m
, 1 dd; stn DW 1723, 23°18’S ,
New Caledonia proper
. MUSORSTOM 4: stn DW 227, 22°46’S , 168°15’E ,
266-267 m
, 1 dd
.

New Hebrides Arc
. VOLSMAR: stn DW 17, Hunter and Matthew stn DW 979, 19°22’S , 169°23’E , 250 m , 1 dd; stn DW 1038, Islands, 22°23’S , 171°41’E , 260-300 m , 1 dd. 16°49’S , 168°30’E , 469-472 m , 1 dd.

DISTRIBUTION. — Indian Ocean: northern Zululand, South Africa , 75 m ( Kosuge 1998 ). Pacific Ocean: from central Honshū ( Japan ) to South China Sea, Philippines , southward to northern Australia ( Kosuge 1998 ; Tsuchiya 2000). From the Coral Sea, southern New Caledonia , Norfolk Ridge, Loyalty Ridge, New Hebrides Arc, Vanuatu and Fiji , empty shells in
200- 469 m
.

REMARKS. — Kosuge (1988 b) considered
Coralliophila deburghiae var. spinosa Dall, 1889
(a different species from Barbados , possibly a synonym of
Babelomurex dalli
) as having priority over the supposed secondary homonyms
Latiaxis spinosus Hirase, 1908
and
Coralliophila spinosa Dall, 1925
(the present species). If this interpretation were correct, then the first available name for this very common species would be
Latiaxis multispinosus Shikama, 1966
. Under the Code ( ICZN 1999: Article 45.6.4),
C. deburghiae var. spinosa Dall, 1889
, is clearly infrasubspecific since the text unambiguously reveals an infrasubspecific intention. I have been unable to find any record of Dall’s (1889) name adopted as a (sub)species before 1985 ( ICZN 1999: Article 45.6.4.1). Therefore,
Latiaxis spinosus Hirase, 1908
, is not threatened by senior homonyms and the current usage should be maintained for this common species, preserving stability.
